message:
I have a domain on name.com. I've changed its nameservers on 13th August, 3 days ago. Unfortunately the old cached addresses are still used by DNS servers. It's very rare for a NS cached record to last for 3 days. Any clue? 
(Note that I use DNS lookup tools not only the local browsing)

data.message: Yes it is so rare, did you tried to access it from TOR Browser or from a proxy, to make sure that the new NS are in action? otherwise i do recommend doing the same action again, change the name servers and save.
Try this website to check regions http://viewdns.info/propagation/?domain=Korabia.com
